title: Authors and Citation
text: Ed Baker. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Baker E (2025). ReVAMP: R Interface Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins. R package version 1.0, http://ebaker..uk/ReVAMP/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ReVAMP: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins},   author = {Ed Baker},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {http://ebaker.me.uk/ReVAMP/}, }

what: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP provides R interface Vamp audio analysis plugin system developed Queen Mary University London’s Centre Digital Music. enables R users load run Vamp plugins Music Information Retrieval (MIR) tasks like tempo detection, onset detection, spectral analysis, feature extraction.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Comprehensive Plugin Support: Access 100+ Vamp plugins audio analysis Automatic Adaptation: Handles channel mixing, domain conversion, buffering automatically Three Output Sample Types: OneSamplePerStep, FixedSampleRate, VariableSampleRate Data Frame Output: Results returned R data frames easy analysis visualization Optional File Export: Optionally write results CSV files

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Install source: install devtools:
code: # Install dependencies install.packages(c("Rcpp", "tuneR"))  # Install ReVAMP install.packages("path/to/ReVAMP_1.0.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type = "source") devtools::install_github("yourusername/ReVAMP")  # Update with actual repo

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP requires external Vamp plugins installed. Use built-installation function: Plugin Directories: - Windows: %USERPROFILE%\Vamp Plugins (user) C:\Program Files\Vamp Plugins (system) - macOS: ~/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Vamp (user) /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Vamp (system) - Linux: ~/.vamp (user) /usr/lib/vamp (system)
code: library(ReVAMP)  # List available plugins for download list_available_plugins()  # Install to user directory (no admin required) install_vamp_plugins("vamp-aubio-plugins", user_dir = TRUE)  # Verify installation plugins <- vampPlugins() head(plugins)

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
code: library(ReVAMP) library(tuneR)  # Load audio file audio <- readWave("myaudio.wav")  # Run amplitude follower and get results as data frame result <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-example-plugins",   id = "amplitudefollower",   output = "amplitude",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",  # Empty string = no file output   useFrames = FALSE  # Use timestamps in seconds )  # Examine results str(result) #> 'data.frame':    1292 obs. of  4 variables: #>  $ timestamp: num  0.000 0.023 0.046 0.070 0.093 ... #>  $ duration : num  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ... #>  $ value    : num  22866 22896 22735 22531 22380 ... #>  $ label    : chr  "" "" "" "" ...  # Plot amplitude over time plot(result$timestamp, result$value, type = "l",      xlab = "Time (s)", ylab = "Amplitude",      main = "Audio Amplitude")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Detect note onsets audio:
code: onsets <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-aubio-plugins",   id = "aubioonset",   output = "onsets",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",   useFrames = FALSE )  # View onset times print(onsets$timestamp)  # Plot onsets on waveform plot(audio) abline(v = onsets$timestamp * audio@samp.rate, col = "red", lty = 2)

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Estimate tempo (BPM):
code: tempo <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-aubio-plugins",   id = "aubiotempo",   output = "tempo",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",   useFrames = FALSE )  cat("Estimated tempo:", mean(tempo$value), "BPM\n")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Analyze spectral characteristics:
code: centroid <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-example-plugins",   id = "spectralcentroid",   output = "logcentroid",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",   useFrames = FALSE )  plot(centroid$timestamp, centroid$value, type = "l",      xlab = "Time (s)", ylab = "Log Centroid",      main = "Spectral Centroid Over Time")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
code: # Get Vamp API/SDK version info vampInfo()  # List plugin search paths vampPaths()  # List all installed plugins with details plugins <- vampPlugins() View(plugins)  # Get parameters for a specific plugin params <- vampParams("vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset") View(params)

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP consists three layers: Vamp Plugin SDK (inst/vamp/): C++ libraries defining Vamp plugin interface Vamp Host SDK (src/Plugin*.cpp): C++ host implementation loads manages plugins R Interface (src/R_host.cpp): Rcpp bindings exposing functionality R Key features: - PluginLoader: Discovers loads Vamp plugins system directories - Plugin Adapters: Automatically handle channel mixing, domain conversion (time/frequency), buffering - DataFrame Output: Collects features memory returns structured data R

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Input: tuneR::Wave S4 objects R Conversion: Extracted float buffers C++ Processing: Fed block--block Vamp plugins automatic adaptation Output: Collected memory returned DataFrame R Optional File: Can also write CSV file outfilename provided

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: package uses standard R/Rcpp development tools:
code: library(devtools)  # Make changes to code...  # Regenerate documentation roxygen2::roxygenise()  # Install locally install()  # Run tests test()  # Run R CMD check check()

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Vamp Plugins: https://www.vamp-plugins.org/ Cannam, C., Landone, C., & Sandler, M. (2010). Sonic Visualiser: open source application viewing, analysing, annotating music audio files. Proceedings 18th ACM International Conference Multimedia, 1467-1468.

what: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: Provides R interface Vamp audio analysis plugin system developed Queen Mary University London's Centre Digital Music. Enables loading running Vamp plugins Music Information Retrieval (MIR) tasks including tempo detection, onset detection, spectral analysis, audio feature extraction.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: ReVAMP package allows R users access extensive library Vamp audio analysis plugins. Key functions include: vampPlugins - List available Vamp plugins runPlugin - Execute plugin audio data install_vamp_plugins - Install plugins online sources See individual function documentation usage examples.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: Name Maintainer: Name <@email.com>

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: Vamp Plugins: https://www.vamp-plugins.org/ Cannam, C., Landone, C., & Sandler, M. (2010). Sonic Visualiser: open source application viewing, analysing, annotating music audio files. Proceedings 18th ACM international conference Multimedia (pp. 1467-1468).

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List available plugins plugins <- vampPlugins() head(plugins)  # Get info about a specific plugin params <- vampParams("vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower")  # Install additional plugins install_vamp_plugins("vamp-aubio-plugins", user_dir = TRUE) } # }

what: Get the appropriate Vamp plugin directory for the current OS — get_vamp_plugin_dir
title: Get the appropriate Vamp plugin directory for the current OS — get_vamp_plugin_dir
text: Get appropriate Vamp plugin directory current OS

title: Get the appropriate Vamp plugin directory for the current OS — get_vamp_plugin_dir
code: get_vamp_plugin_dir(user_dir = TRUE)

title: Get the appropriate Vamp plugin directory for the current OS — get_vamp_plugin_dir
text: user_dir TRUE, use user-specific directory; FALSE, use system directory

title: Get the appropriate Vamp plugin directory for the current OS — get_vamp_plugin_dir
text: Path Vamp plugin directory

title: Get the appropriate Vamp plugin directory for the current OS — get_vamp_plugin_dir
text: Windows, system directory (C:\Program Files\Vamp Plugins) may require administrator rights. User directory recommended non-admin installations.

what: Download and install Vamp plugins — install_vamp_plugins
title: Download and install Vamp plugins — install_vamp_plugins
text: Download install Vamp plugins

title: Download and install Vamp plugins — install_vamp_plugins
code: install_vamp_plugins(plugin_names = NULL, user_dir = TRUE, verbose = TRUE)

title: Download and install Vamp plugins — install_vamp_plugins
text: plugin_names Character vector plugin names install (list_available_plugins()), NULL install first available user_dir TRUE, install user-specific directory; FALSE, install system-wide (may require admin) verbose TRUE, print progress messages

title: Download and install Vamp plugins — install_vamp_plugins
text: Invisibly returns logical vector indicating success plugin

title: Download and install Vamp plugins — install_vamp_plugins
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List available plugins list_available_plugins()  # Install specific plugin to user directory (no admin required) install_vamp_plugins("vamp-aubio-plugins", user_dir = TRUE)  # Install to system directory (may require admin rights) install_vamp_plugins("vamp-aubio-plugins", user_dir = FALSE) } # }

what: List available Vamp plugins for download — list_available_plugins
title: List available Vamp plugins for download — list_available_plugins
text: List available Vamp plugins download

title: List available Vamp plugins for download — list_available_plugins
code: list_available_plugins(platform = NULL)

title: List available Vamp plugins for download — list_available_plugins
text: platform Platform filter : "win32", "osx", "linux" (default: current OS)

title: List available Vamp plugins for download — list_available_plugins
text: data frame plugin names, descriptions, download URLs

what: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: Executes Vamp audio analysis plugin Wave object writes results CSV file. main function performing audio feature extraction analysis.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
code: runPlugin(myname, soname, id, output, outputNo, wave, outfilename, useFrames)

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: myname Character string user identification (used output) soname Character string specifying plugin library name (e.g., "vamp-example-plugins", "vamp-aubio-plugins") id Character string specifying plugin identifier within library (e.g., "amplitudefollower", "aubioonset") output Character string specifying plugin output use. Plugins may provide multiple output types. Use vampPlugins see available outputs. outputNo Integer specifying output number (typically 0 first output) wave Wave object tuneR package containing audio data analyze. Can mono stereo. outfilename Character string specifying path output CSV file useFrames Logical indicating whether use frame numbers (TRUE) timestamps (FALSE) output

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: Invisibly returns NULL. Results written specified output file.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: plugin automatically adapt audio characteristics: Channel mixing/augmentation plugin requirements differ input Time/frequency domain conversion needed Buffering handle different block sizes Output format varies plugin typically includes: Timestamp frame number Duration (applicable) Feature values Text label (applicable) function supports three Vamp output sample types: OneSamplePerStep: Regular intervals based step size FixedSampleRate: Output fixed rate (may differ input) VariableSampleRate: Sparse output irregular intervals

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(tuneR)  # Load audio file audio <- readWave("myaudio.wav")  # Run amplitude follower plugin runPlugin(   myname = "user",   soname = "vamp-example-plugins",   id = "amplitudefollower",   output = "amplitude",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "amplitude.csv",   useFrames = TRUE )  # Run onset detection runPlugin(   myname = "user",   soname = "vamp-aubio-plugins",   id = "aubioonset",   output = "onsets",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "onsets.csv",   useFrames = FALSE ) } # }

what: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
text: Returns information Vamp API SDK versions used ReVAMP.

title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
code: vampInfo()

title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
text: list two elements: API version Integer indicating Vamp API version (typically 2) SDK version Character string indicating Vamp SDK version (e.g., "2.10")

title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get version information vampInfo() } # }

what: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampParams
title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampParams
text: Returns detailed information configurable parameters given Vamp plugin. Parameters can adjusted customize plugin behavior.

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampParams
code: vampParams(key)

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampParams
text: key Character string specifying plugin key "library:plugin" format (e.g., "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubionotes"). Use vampPlugins get plugin IDs.

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampParams
text: data frame one row per parameter columns including: identifier Parameter identifier name Human-readable parameter name description Parameter description unit Unit measurement (applicable) min_value Minimum allowed value max_value Maximum allowed value default_value Default value quantized Logical indicating parameter quantized discrete values Returns empty data frame plugin configurable parameters.

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampParams
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get parameters for aubio onset detector params <- vampParams("vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset") } # }

what: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
text: Returns list directories ReVAMP searches Vamp plugins. search paths determined Vamp Host SDK typically include system-wide plugin directories user-specific directories.

title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
code: vampPaths()

title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
text: character vector directory paths

title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List plugin search paths vampPaths() } # }

what: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
text: Enumerates Vamp plugins found plugin search paths returns detailed information plugin including metadata, parameters, audio processing requirements.

title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
code: vampPlugins()

title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
text: data frame one row per plugin columns including: library Plugin library name (without extension) name Human-readable plugin name id Unique plugin identifier (library:plugin format) plugin.version Plugin version number vamp.api.version Vamp API version plugin uses maker Plugin author/creator copyright Copyright information description Detailed plugin description input.domain Input domain: "Time Domain" "Frequency Domain" default.step.size Default step size samples default.block.size Default block size samples minimum.channels Minimum number audio channels required maximum.channels Maximum number audio channels supported

title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all installed plugins plugins <- vampPlugins()  # Filter for specific library aubio_plugins <- plugins[plugins$library == "vamp-aubio-plugins", ] } # }
